title: Ticket #59: There exists a set of Windows executables that Condor cannot identify.
description:
There exists a set of Windows executables that Condor cannot identify correctly. A user submitted and executable on the condor-users list that can be executed from a Windows console, but will not pass Condor's executable tests.

It is possible for a test program to determine that it is a Win32 executable via a call to GetBinaryType(); however, it too fails on MapAndLoad(). Both of these calls are used in Condor, but the call to GetBinaryType() fails in Condor, which is a bit of an oddity to me.
remarks:
2009-Jan-22 10:26:13 by tannenba:
While we are at it, when Condor DOES conclude that the executable is not a legit binary, that error should propagate back to the user instead of just sitting in the starter log. So Create_Process should set return_errno appropriately, and the starter should check errno is Create_Process fails and EXCEPT with a more specific/helpful error message (which Condor then propagates back to the shadow & user log).

2009-Oct-21 15:31:12 by psilord:
Ben Burnett has left the Condor Project. This ticket is being unassigned.
2010-Oct-20 15:59:08 by jfrey:
Bulk change of target version from v070504 to v070505 using ./ticket-target-mover.
2011-Jan-27 14:21:33 by danb:
Bulk change of target version from v070505 to v070506 using ./ticket-target-mover.
2011-Feb-01 14:49:30 by tannenba:
Bulk change of target version from v070506 to NULL using ./ticket-target-mover.
attachments:

    An executable that Condor does not identify correctly.
  • MULTI.C 243 bytes added by burnett on 2009-Jan-30 18:56:11 UTC.
    Source code for the executable Condor incorrectly identifies. If compiled with VS2K8 the executable runs fine.
creator: tannenba
